index.title: SC Champions - Digital Sports Training & Competition System
index.description: SC Champions is the modern gamification system for table tennis clubs. Manage training, matches and Elo rankings digitally.

hero.title: Turn your training into a game.
hero.subtitle: Welcome to SC Champions ‚Äì the gamification platform that takes your club's sports training to the next level.
hero.notice: Notice: SC Champions is currently a research project as part of a bachelor's thesis and is in the testing phase.

gamification.title: Gamification System
gamification.description: Earn XP, level up and unlock new achievements.

matches.title: Match Tracking
matches.description: Record games, calculate Elo ratings and track your progress.

training.title: Training Planning
training.description: Plan your training, set goals and track your improvement.

leaderboard.title: Leaderboards
leaderboard.description: Compare yourself with other players and climb the rankings.

community.title: Community
community.description: Connect with other players and challenge them.

stats.title: Statistics
stats.description: Analyze your performance with detailed statistics and charts.

xp.title: Earn XP & Elo
xp.description: Earn experience points (XP) for dedication and attendance, and boost your skill rating (Elo) in matches. A dual system for real progress.

ranks.title: Rise in Ranks
ranks.description: Start as a üî∞ Recruit and fight your way up to üëë Champion. Your permanent rank shows your true progress and keeps you motivated.

roles.title: For Players & Coaches
roles.description: Players report matches and track their progress. Coaches manage attendance digitally, award points, and create daily challenges for entire groups.

streaks.title: Attendance Streaks
streaks.description: Consistency pays off! Build a streak by never missing practice and earn bonus XP for your commitment.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What is the difference between Elo, XP, and Season Points?
faq.a1: In short: XP (Dedication) are permanent points you earn from training and exercises that you never lose. They determine your rank. Elo (Skill) is your playing strength that you win or lose in matches. Season Points are temporary for the 6-week competition and reset afterwards.
faq.q2: How does the Elo system work?
faq.a2_intro: The Elo system calculates your playing strength based on your match results. The more games you play, the more stable your rating becomes.
faq.a2_note: New players start at 800 Elo. The higher factor at the beginning ensures you quickly reach your true level.
faq.q3: How do I rise in rank?
faq.a3: To rise in rank (e.g., from üî∞ Recruit to ü•â Bronze), you must meet two conditions: a minimum level of XP (Dedication) and a minimum level of Elo (Skill). For the very first promotion to Bronze, you must also complete 5 basic exercises.
faq.a4: A "Streak" is an attendance series. If you attend training sessions consecutively (per subgroup), you earn bonus XP. Miss a session and your streak for that group resets. Consistency really pays off!

faq.title: FAQ & Rules
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about SC Champions.

questions.eloVsXp: What is the difference between Elo, XP and Season Points?
questions.qttrConversion: How are QTTR points converted to Elo?
questions.singlesPoints: How do points work in singles matches?
questions.handicapSystem: How does the handicap system work?
questions.attendancePoints: How does the attendance point system work?
questions.exercisesPoints: How do exercises and points work?
questions.milestones: What are milestone exercises and challenges?
questions.seasonReset: How does the season reset work?
questions.ranksLeaderboard: How do ranks and the leaderboard work?

answers.eloVsXp:
There are three types of points you can collect:
  • Skill (Elo/Q-TTR): This is your permanent playing strength. You start with 1200 Elo points. You gain Elo by winning competitive matches against others. You lose Elo when you lose. The calculation is based on the Q-TTR system of the German Table Tennis Association. Your Elo value significantly determines your rank.
  • Effort (XP): These are your permanent experience points. You gain XP for almost everything: attendance, exercises, challenges and match wins. XP is never deducted - you can only gain it! XP (just like Elo) is necessary for your rank advancement. However, penalties for unsportsmanlike behavior can also cost XP (see below).
  • Season Points: These points are only for the "Season Competition" (every 6 weeks). They are awarded for attendance, exercises, challenges and matches. Unlike XP, you can lose Season Points from match losses or penalties. At the end of the season they are reset.
answers.qttrConversion:
We use the Q-TTR system (Quality Table Tennis Rating), which is also used by the German Table Tennis Association.

The Formula:

Win Probability: P = 1 / (1 + 10^(Diff/150))

New Points: Elo_new = Elo_old + 16 √ó (Result - P)

(Result: Win=1, Loss=0)

Example Calculation:

Player A (1200 Elo) vs Player B (1040 Elo) - Difference: 160

  • A wins (expected): A gets +2, B gets -2
  • B wins (surprise): B gets +14, A gets -14

Important:

  • The point change is symmetrical: What the winner gains, the loser loses.
  • Wins against stronger opponents bring more points.
  • Losses against stronger opponents cost fewer points.
  • Without QTTR input, players start with 1200 Elo.
answers.singlesPoints:
When you play a competitive match (no handicap match), your Elo points and your Season Points are adjusted. Your XP can only increase.

  • Win: You gain Elo points, Season Points and XP.
  • Loss: You lose Elo points and Season Points. You do not lose XP.
  • Fairness: If you win against a stronger player (higher Elo), you receive more points. If you lose against a stronger player, you only lose a few points.

Important for Recruits: As a Recruit (lowest rank) you must first complete 5 basic exercises before you are allowed to play competitive matches. This ensures you have mastered the basics!
answers.handicapSystem:
The handicap system ensures fair games between players of different strengths. There are two types of handicap suggestions:

1. Elo-based Handicap:

From 40 Elo points difference, a handicap is suggested. The weaker player starts each set with a points advantage.

  • 40-79 Elo difference: +1 point
  • 80-119 Elo difference: +2 points
  • 120-159 Elo difference: +3 points
  • 160-199 Elo difference: +4 points
  • ... up to +7 points maximum

2. Head-to-Head Handicap:

When a player wins 2x or more in a row against the same opponent, a dynamic handicap is suggested:

  • 2 wins in a row: +1 point for the loser
  • 3 wins in a row: +2 points
  • 4 wins in a row: +3 points
  • ... up to +7 points maximum

With a win by the other player, the handicap is reset.

Elo Change in Handicap Matches:

In handicap matches, a fixed point value is awarded, regardless of the Elo difference:

  • Win with handicap: +8 Elo (fixed)
  • Loss with handicap: -8 Elo (fixed)

Tip: The handicap is optional - both players must agree to activate it.
answers.doublesMatches:
In addition to singles matches, you can also play doubles matches! In doubles, you play with a partner against another team.

The Process:

  • Form team: You choose a partner (Team A) and two opponents (Team B)
  • Send request: The opposing team must confirm the request
  • Coach approval: After confirmation, a coach must approve the match and enter the result
  • Points: All 4 players receive or lose doubles Elo points

Doubles Elo System:

  • You have a separate doubles Elo (starts at 800), independent of your singles Elo
  • The team Elo is calculated from the average of both players
  • Example: Player A (Doubles Elo 900) + Player B (Doubles Elo 1000) = Team Elo 950
  • As in singles: Wins against stronger teams bring more points

Doubles Leaderboard:

There is a separate doubles leaderboard that you can find in the Leaderboard tab. There you can see which teams have the best doubles Elo values!

Points Calculation:

  • Win: Both players of the winning team receive Doubles Elo and Season Points
  • Loss: Both players of the losing team lose Doubles Elo and Season Points
  • XP: As in singles, only the winning team receives XP (no XP loss on defeat)
  • Handicap: Doubles matches can also be played with handicap (no Elo change)

Tip: Doubles matches are a great way to train teamwork and learn new playing styles. Even if you're not very strong in singles yet, you can be successful in doubles with a good partner!
answers.losePoints:
Yes, you can lose points ‚Äì even XP, but only for serious violations!
  • Match loss: You lose Elo and Season Points (see above). You do not lose XP.
  • Minor violations (e.g. not listening to instructions, not helping with setup):
    -10 Season Points and -5 XP
  • Medium violations (e.g. not training properly, messing around, throwing balls):
    -20 Season Points and -10 XP
  • Serious violations (e.g. disrespectful behavior towards coaches or fellow players):
    -30 Season Points and -20 XP

Important: Penalties hit you twice ‚Äì they deduct both Season Points and XP. So: Stay fair and treat each other respectfully!
answers.attendancePoints:
Points for Training Attendance:

For each training you receive points (Season & XP). The amount depends on your "streak" ‚Äì a series of consecutive trainings:

  • Normal attendance (1-2x in a row): +3 points
  • Streak bonus (3-4x in a row): +5 points
  • Super streak (5x or more): +6 points

Multiple trainings on the same day:

If you participate in multiple trainings on the same day (e.g. Basic Training 4-5 PM and Performance Training 5-6 PM), the following applies:

  • 1st training of the day: Full points (3/5/6 depending on streak)
  • 2nd training of the day: Half points (rounded up)
    • 3 points ‚Üí 2 points (1.5 rounded up)
    • 5 points ‚Üí 3 points (2.5 rounded up)
    • 6 points ‚Üí 3 points

Important: If you miss a training, your streak is reset to zero. Regular training pays off!
answers.exercisesPoints:
Exercises are divided into three difficulty levels: Easy, Medium and Hard. The points you receive depend on both the difficulty of the exercise and your current level:

Important: The higher your level, the more points you get for the same exercise. The system automatically calculates the points based on your current rank and the exercise difficulty.

You receive both Season Points and XP in equal amounts.
answers.milestones:
Some exercises and challenges use a tiered point system with milestones. This means: The more often you complete an exercise, the more points you can earn in total!

Example: Endless Serve Exercise

  • 1√ó completed ‚Üí 3 points
  • 3√ó completed ‚Üí +5 points (total 8 points)
  • 5√ó completed ‚Üí +8 points (total 16 points)

How does it work?

  • The points are cumulative ‚Äì you get all points up to the milestone reached.
  • Each milestone can only be reached once per season.
  • Your coach sees your current progress when awarding you points.
  • After the season reset (every 6 weeks) you can reach all milestones again!
answers.seasonReset:
Every 6 weeks (42 days) a new season is started. The reset occurs automatically at midnight.

What is reset?

  • Season Points: Reset to 0
  • League placements: Top 2 of each league advance, bottom 2 are relegated
  • Milestone progress: All milestones can be reached again
  • Completion status: Exercises and challenges can be completed again

What is retained?

  • Singles Elo: Your singles skill rating remains permanent
  • Doubles Elo: Your doubles skill rating remains permanent
  • XP (Experience Points): Your effort is never reset
  • Rank: Your rank (Recruit, Bronze, Silver...) is permanent
  • Basic completions: The 5 basic exercises remain completed

Tip: On the dashboard you see a countdown to the next season reset. Use the time to quickly collect points and climb your league!
answers.ranksLeaderboard:
Your rank (e.g. Recruit, Bronze, Silver) is permanent and is never reset. To advance in rank, you must reach certain milestones in Elo (Skill) and XP (Effort).

The ranks and their requirements:

  • Recruit (Start): 0-49 XP, 1200 Elo, 0 basics
    You start here with 1200 Elo and 0 XP.
  • Bronze: 50+ XP, 850+ Elo, 5 basics
    Learn the basics first before you're allowed to play matches!
  • Silver: 200+ XP, 900+ Elo
  • Gold: 500+ XP, 1000+ Elo
  • Platinum: 1000+ XP, 1100+ Elo
  • Champion: 1800+ XP, 1300+ Elo
    The elite - only the best make it here!

Important: You must always fulfill both requirements (Elo AND XP) for the next rank. For Bronze you must additionally complete 5 basic exercises.

The Leaderboard is divided into several tabs:

  • Effort (XP): Shows the leaderboard based on experience points.
  • Season (Points): Shows the current season leaderboard.
  • Skill (Elo): Shows the leaderboard based on singles Elo points.
  • Ranks (Level): Shows all players grouped by their current rank (e.g. all in Bronze, all in Silver).
  • Doubles (Teams): Shows the doubles leaderboard with the best team combinations based on doubles Elo.

You can configure which leaderboards you want to see in the Leaderboard tab.

guardianFaq.title: Parents & Kids FAQ
guardianFaq.subtitle: How SC Champions works for families

overview.title: SC Champions - At a Glance
overview.description: SC Champions is a gamification platform for sports clubs. Kids collect points, level up in ranks, and have fun while training!

questions.howToAddChild: How do I add my child?
questions.childCredentials: How do username and PIN work?
questions.inviteSecondGuardian: Can I invite a second guardian?
questions.whatCanISee: What can I see as a guardian?
questions.childTurns16: What happens when my child turns 16?
questions.forgotPin: What if I forgot my PIN?
questions.whatCanChildDo: What can I do in the app?
questions.howPointsWork: How does the points system work?
questions.dataProtection: How is my child's data protected?
questions.deleteData: Can I have my child's data deleted?

answers.whatIsGuardian:
A guardian account is a special parent account on SC Champions. As a guardian, you can:

  • Add and manage your children in the app
  • Create login credentials (username & PIN) for your children
  • Track your children's progress
  • Invite a second guardian (e.g., partner/spouse)
  • Control your children's privacy settings

You can be a guardian and a player yourself ‚Äì with a single account!
answers.howToAddChild:
You have two options to add your child:

1. With Trainer Code (recommended):

  • Your child's trainer gives you a code (e.g., TTV-ABC-123)
  • Enter this code in the app
  • Your child is automatically linked with their existing profile

2. Add Manually:

  • Click "Add Child" in the Guardian Dashboard
  • Enter your child's data (name, birthdate, sport)
  • A new profile will be created

Tip: With a trainer code, your child's entire progress is preserved!
answers.trainerCode:
A trainer code is a one-time code created by your child's coach. With this code you can:

  • Link your child's existing profile to your guardian account
  • Keep all their points, ranks, and achievements
  • Get started right away without setting up a new profile

How to get the code:

  1. Ask your child's coach to create a code
  2. The code looks like this: TTV-XXX-XXX
  3. The code can only be used once and is valid for 7 days
answers.childCredentials:
To allow your child to log in independently, you can create a username and PIN:

Username:

  • A unique name your child can remember
  • E.g., "max2015" or "lena_ttv"
  • 3-20 characters, only letters, numbers, and underscores

PIN:

  • A 4 to 6-digit number
  • Easy to remember for kids
  • Can be changed by you at any time

Important: Keep the credentials safe. If the PIN is forgotten, you can always set a new one in the Guardian Dashboard.
answers.inviteSecondGuardian:
Yes! You can invite a second guardian, e.g., your partner or grandparents:

  1. Go to the Guardian Dashboard
  2. Select the child you want to invite someone for
  3. Click "Invite Second Guardian"
  4. You'll receive an invitation code valid for 48 hours
  5. Share this code with the person you want to invite

The second guardian can then:

  • View the child's progress
  • Change the login credentials
  • Manage the child in case of emergency
answers.whatCanISee:
As a guardian, you have full insight into your child's activities:

  • Overview: Current rank, level, XP, and Elo points
  • Progress: Completed exercises and challenges
  • Attendance: When your child was at training
  • Matches: Played competitions and results
  • Leaderboard: Position in the club and globally
  • Activity Feed: Latest achievements and events

You see everything your child does in the app ‚Äì but other players only see what the privacy settings allow.
answers.childTurns16:
At 16, your child can upgrade to an independent account:

  • What happens: Your child gets their own email address for login
  • What stays: All points, ranks, achievements, and match history
  • What changes: You no longer have guardian access

How the upgrade works:

  1. An "Upgrade Account" button appears in the Guardian Dashboard
  2. Enter an email address for your child
  3. Your child receives an email with a confirmation link
  4. After confirmation, they can log in with email/password

Good to know: The upgrade is optional. Children can continue using the username/PIN login even after turning 16.
answers.howToLogin:
Your parents gave you a username and PIN? Here's how to log in:

  1. Open the SC Champions app or website
  2. Click on "Kids Login"
  3. Enter your username (e.g., "max2015")
  4. Enter your PIN (4-6 numbers)
  5. Click "Log in"

Tip: Remember your username and PIN well! If you forget them, your parents can give you new ones.
answers.forgotPin:
No problem! Your parents can give you a new PIN:

  1. Ask your parents to log into their guardian account
  2. In the Guardian Dashboard, they can reset your PIN
  3. You'll get a new PIN

Important: You cannot change your PIN yourself. Only your parents can do this to keep your account safe.
answers.whatCanChildDo:
In SC Champions you can do a lot:

  • Collect points: For training, exercises, and matches
  • Level up ranks: From Recruit to Champion!
  • Do exercises: Learn new techniques and earn XP
  • Play matches: Play against others and increase your Elo
  • Check leaderboard: See where you rank in the club
  • Unlock achievements: Collect badges and awards

Cool: The more you train, the more points you get ‚Äì and the higher you climb in the ranks!
answers.privacyForKids:
Your profile is specially protected because you're young:

  • Club only: Usually only people from your club can see your profile
  • First name only: Others only see your first name, not your last name
  • No strangers: People outside your club cannot find you
  • Parents decide: Your parents can set who sees what

If you have questions about this, ask your parents!
answers.howPointsWork:
In SC Champions there are three types of points:

  • XP (Experience Points):
    Points you never lose! You get XP for everything: training, exercises, winning matches.
  • Elo (Skill Rating):
    Shows how well you play. Goes up when you win, down when you lose.
  • Season Points:
    Points for the current season (6 weeks). Reset afterwards.

Tip: XP and your rank stay forever ‚Äì so train regularly!
answers.howRanksWork:
The more XP and Elo you collect, the higher you climb:

üî∞
Recruit ‚Äì Where you start
ü•â
Bronze ‚Äì 50 XP, 850 Elo, 5 basics
ü•à
Silver ‚Äì 200 XP, 900 Elo
ü•á
Gold ‚Äì 500 XP, 1000 Elo
üíé
Platinum ‚Äì 1000 XP, 1100 Elo
üèÜ
Champion ‚Äì 1800 XP, 1300 Elo
answers.howToEarnPoints:
You can earn points in many ways:

  • Attend training: 3-6 points per session
  • Complete exercises: 2-10 points depending on difficulty
  • Master challenges: Bonus points for special tasks
  • Win matches: XP and Elo points
  • Keep streaks: More points when you come regularly!

Super tip: Come to training regularly! After 5 sessions in a row, you get 6 points instead of 3!
answers.whatIsLeaderboard:
The leaderboard shows who has the most points:

  • Effort Leaderboard: Who has the most XP?
  • Skill Leaderboard: Who has the highest Elo?
  • Season Leaderboard: Who's leading this season?
  • Doubles Leaderboard: The best doubles teams

You can switch between Club (your club only) and Global (all players).

Can you make it into the Top 10? üèÜ
answers.dataProtection:
We take the protection of your child very seriously:

  • GDPR compliant: All data is processed according to EU data protection law
  • Encrypted: Passwords and PINs are stored securely
  • No ads: We don't sell data and don't show advertisements
  • Minimal data: We only collect what's necessary for the app
  • Control: You can export or delete all data at any time

Find more details in our Privacy Policy.
answers.childModePrivacy:
Child mode automatically activates enhanced privacy settings:

  • Limited visibility: Profile is only visible to club members by default
  • No last name: Only the first name is shown in leaderboards
  • Protected search: The child cannot be found by strangers
  • Parental control: Guardians can adjust all settings

Child mode is automatically active for all players under 16 years old.
answers.deleteData:
Yes, you have the right to delete your child's data:

  1. Go to your guardian account settings
  2. Select "Legal Information"
  3. Click "Delete Account" for the child

What gets deleted:

  • Personal data (name, birthdate)
  • Login credentials (username, PIN)
  • The connection to the guardian account

What stays (anonymized):

  • Match results (as "Deleted User")
  • Team statistics

Alternatively, you can also contact us by email: datenschutz@sc-champions.de
